H0.text: what countries have german as the official language. Germany

H1.text: what countries have german as the official language. Austria

H2.text: what countries have german as the official language. Switzerland

H3.text: what countries have german as the official language. Canada

A4.text: German is the majority and official (or co-official) language in Germany, Austria, Switzerland, and Liechtenstein.

A5.text: German is the official language of the following countries: Germany, Austria, 17 cantons of Switzerland, Liechtenstein.

A6.text: German was disseminated across Europe around 1913.

A7.text: Encyclopædia Britannica (11th ed.) 1911 included an entry titled 'German Language'.

A8.text: In 2020, 62.3% of the population of Switzerland were native speakers of German at home.

A9.text: German is the dominant language in Switzerland.

A10.text: German is the official language of six countries, all of which lie in central and western Europe.

A11.text: German is an official language of the following international institutions: International sports associations: European Handball Federation (EHF) Fédération Internationale de Bobsleigh et de Tobogganing (FIBT) Fédération Internationale de Football Association (FIFA) Fédération Internationale de Luge de Course (FIL) Fédération Internationale de Ski (FIS) International Biathlon Union (IBU) Union of European Football Associations (UEFA)
